exercises.question: Which of the following best describes a 'bottleneck' in an administrative context?
options: A useful tool for organizing physical files.
A point in a process where work is delayed due to limited capacity.
A person who is promoted to a senior role.
The final step in a successful project.

exercises.question: What does 'to streamline' a process mean?
options: To make it more complex and detailed.
To hire more people to do the same task.
To make a process more efficient by removing unnecessary steps.
To ignore the process and do things your own way.

exercises.question: By the end of the year, we ________ (reduce) our paper waste by 50%. (Future Perfect)
This time next week, the team ________ (use) the new CRM system. (Future Continuous)
If a task is 'error-prone', it means:
options: It is very easy to do correctly.
It is likely to result in mistakes.
It is always done by a machine.
It is the most important task of the day.

exercises.title: Email: Proposing an Improvement
exercises.description: Write a short email (100-150 words) to your manager proposing that you automate the weekly 'Ops Board' update. Mention that the current process is manual and 'error-prone'. Use at least one instance of Future Perfect to describe the benefit.
exercises.sampleAnswer:
Subject: Proposal to automate the weekly Ops Board update

Dear Sarah,

I am writing to suggest a small improvement to our weekly workflow. Currently, we are manually updating the Ops Board, which is quite time-consuming and, frankly, error-prone during busy periods.

I propose that we integrate our task tracker directly with the board using a simple automation script. By implementing this solution, we will be saving approximately three hours of manual entry per week. 

I am confident that by the end of next month, we will have eliminated all manual data entry errors in this specific area. This will allow the team to focus on more high-value tasks.

I would like to align on next steps for this project when you have a moment.

Kind regards,

[Your Name]

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: I've noticed that we're both logging the same meeting minutes in the shared drive and the CRM.

dialogue.speaker: Elena
dialogue.text: You're right. That's a clear redundancy. We should map out the process to see where we can gain efficiency.

dialogue.speaker: Mark
dialogue.text: If we automate the sync, we will be saving a lot of time. By Friday, I will have set up the test.
